content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) Attribute the work shown to the specific culture from West and Central Asia (500 B.C.E.—1980 C.E.) that created it. Using at least two examples of specific visual evidence, justify your attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type by the same specific culture. Using at least two examples of specific visual and/or contextual evidence, explain how the work reflects the cultural context in which works of this type were created.

unit.text: 7: West and Central Asia, 500 BCE - 1980 CE

topic.text: 7.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in West and Central Asian Art

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Explain how a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
